definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to

sentences.english: O, boy! Is Last night's wine of Loess Plateau sweet?
sentences.chinese: 男孩啊，黃土高坡昨夜的酒，可好。

sentences.english: I was just about to seek his help when he turned up.
sentences.chinese: 我正想找他來幫忙，可好他來了。

sentences.english: I'll get the cast and go for sardines. Will you sit in the sun in the doorway?
sentences.chinese: 我拿魚網撈沙丁魚去。你坐在門口曬曬太陽可好？

sentences.english: How are you recently?I miss you badly.
sentences.chinese: 老哥最近可好？想你想壞了。

sentences.english: This morning, I eat breakfast is a face, taste Kehao of.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上，我喫的是面，味道可好了。

sentences.english: He was able to retain all the former vocabulary words and did great in the review portion of class.
sentences.chinese: 掌握了以前的詞彙，在複習時表現可好了。

sentences.english: I had lived in the heaven for a long time , and what up in Fruits hill.
sentences.chinese: 在天庭住好一陣子了，不知你在花果山過得可好？

sentences.english: I bought my Samsung tv just in time.
sentences.chinese: 我可好，剛買了三星電視。

sentences.english: May I know if my daughter has done well in the team?
sentences.chinese: 我想知道我的女兒在隊裏表現得可好？

sentences.english: After I 18 wear high-heeled shoes is for you.
sentences.chinese: 待我18歲爲你穿上高跟鞋可好。

sentences.english: Our teacher is good to me.
sentences.chinese: 我們的老師對我可好了。

sentences.english: I have stayed in the palace for a long time, how are you in Huaguo Mountain?
sentences.chinese: 在天庭住好一陣子了，不知你在花果山過得可好？

definition: I/me/my/(often used in early vernacular literature)
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
to avoid/so as to save (money or time)
a good deal of/quite a lot
to let sb down/to be unfair/I'm sorry/pardon me (formal)
to come to an agreement/to complete negotiations
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
